Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a [+1/+1 or charge] counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Support N (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to N (other) target creatures.)
Surge [cost] (You may cast a spell for its surge cost if you or a teammate have cast another spell in the same turn.)

Surveil N (Look at the top N cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top of your library in any order.)\nSurveil 1 (Look at the top card of your library. You may put it into your graveyard.)

Suspend N — [cost] (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay [cost] and exile it with N time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)
Cycling [cost] (Discard this card: Draw a card.)\n[type]cycling [cost] (Discard this card: Search your library for a [type] card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
[Type] Landwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a [type].)
Sweep — Return any number of [basic land] you control to their owner's hand. ...
To turn a permanent sideways from an upright position.
Tempting offer — [do something]. Each opponent may [do the same]. For each opponent who does, [do something again].
Threshold — As long as there are seven or more cards in your graveyard, …
Totem armor (If enchanted permanent would be destroyed, instead remove all damage marked on it and destroy this Aura.)
Training (Whenever this creature attacks with another creature with greater power, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)

Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to a player or planeswalker it's attacking.)\nTrample over planeswalkers (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the controller of the planeswalker it's attacking.)

Transfigure [cost] ([Cost], Sacrifice this permanent: Search your library for a creature card with the same mana value as this permanent, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle. Transfigure only as a sorcery.)
To turn a double-faced card so its other face is up.
Transmute [cost] ([cost], Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same mana value as this card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Transmute only as a sorcery.)
Tribute N (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place N +1/+1 counters on it.)
Cycling [cost] (Discard this card: Draw a card.)\n[type]cycling [cost] (Discard this card: Search your library for a [type] card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
Undaunted (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each opponent.)
Underdog — If you've lost a game this match, …
Undergrowth — ... the number of creature cards in your graveyard.\n... for each creature card in your graveyard.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

Unearth [cost] (Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
To rotate a permanent back to the upright position from a sideways position.
Vanishing N (This permanent enters the battlefield with N time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)

Venture into the dungeon (Enter the first room or advance to the next room)\nVenture into [quality] (If you’re in a dungeon, advance to the next room. If you’re not, enter [quality]. Enter the first room or advance to the next room)
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Some cards instruct players to vote from among given options.
Ward [cost] (Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays [cost].)
Will of the council — ... starting with you, each player votes for ...
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
